title: Add config option to show all sessions in notification bar (not just waiting)
body:
## Feature Request

Currently the notification bar in the tmux status line only shows sessions with `StatusWaiting`. When attached to a session, I'd like to see **all other sessions** (running, idle, waiting, error) so I can quickly switch between them with `Ctrl+b 1-6`.

## Current Behavior

The notification bar only appears when another session transitions to "waiting" state, and is cleared once you attach to that session. When inside a session, you have no visibility into your other sessions.

From the debug logs:
```
bar_updated: "⚡ [1] test"       (current_session_id: "")
bar_updated: ""                   (current_session_id: "ef515f19...")
```

## Desired Behavior

A config option like `show_all` under `[notifications]` that shows all sessions (excluding the currently attached one) in the notification bar, with status indicators:

```toml
[notifications]
  enabled = true
  show_all = true    # show all sessions, not just waiting
```

Bar output would look like:
```
⚡ [1] ● frontend [2] ◐ api [3] ○ backend
```

Where `●` = running, `◐` = waiting, `○` = idle, `✕` = error.

## Implementation Notes

The change is small and contained to 3 files:

1. **`internal/session/userconfig.go`** — Add `ShowAll bool` to `NotificationsConfig` struct
2. **`internal/session/notifications.go`** — In `SyncFromInstances()` line 176, change the filter condition:
   ```go
   // Current (waiting only):
   if inst.GetStatusThreadSafe() == StatusWaiting && inst.ID != currentSessionID {
   
   // With show_all:
   if inst.ID != currentSessionID && (showAll || inst.GetStatusThreadSafe() == StatusWaiting) {
   ```
3. **`internal/session/notifications.go`** — In `FormatBar()`, optionally include a status icon per entry
4. **`internal/ui/home.go`** — Pass the `ShowAll` config through to the notification manager

The `currentSessionID` exclusion should still be kept (no need to see your own session in the bar).

## Use Case

When running multiple concurrent AI coding sessions, I want to see all of them in the tmux status bar so I can jump between them instantly — not just the ones that happen to be waiting. This makes the multi-session workflow much more fluid.
